application_type_full: Outline planning permission: Some matters reserved
description:
The redevelopment of the site to provide a residential
care home for the elderly with 55 bedrooms plus
ancillary staff  utility and common rooms and the
provision of 10 parking spaces; at rear of 10  as shown
on drawing nos. SK20  21  22  23.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The facing materials to be used on the building shall not
    be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and
    approved by the Council before any work on the site is
    commenced.

Condition : 2 - No development shall take place until full details of hard
    and soft landscaping and means of enclosure of all unbuilt,
    open areas have been submitted to and approved by the
    Council.

Condition : 3 - All trees on the site, or parts of trees growing from
    diseased during that period shall be replaced as soon as is
    reasonably possible and, in any case, by not later than the
    end of the following planting season, with trees of such
    size and species and in such positions as may be agreed
    with the Council, without prejudice to any further action
    the Council may consider appropriate to secure the
    protection of existing trees.
    adjoining sites, unless shown on the permitted drawings as
    being removed, shall be retained and protected from damage
    to the satisfaction of the Council for a period of at least
    12 months following the completion of the development
    hereby approved, or such longer period as may be required
    under Sections 198 and 211 of the Town and Country Planning
    Act 1990.  Any trees removed without the Council's consent
    or dying or being severely damaged or becoming seriously

Condition : 4 - No development shall commence on site until a general site
    investigation in accordance with BSIDD:175:1988 has been
    undertaken and submitted to the Council for assessment and
    that all such measures as are considered necessary in the
    light of the above assessment are incorporated into the
    development.

Condition : 5 - The whole of the car parking accommodation shown on the
    drawings shall be provided and retained permanently for the
    parking of vehicles of the occupiers and users of the
    remainder of the building.

Condition : 6 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building.

Condition : 7 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 8 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied that the
    development will not have an adverse effect on existing
    trees and in order to maintain the character and amenities
    of the area.

Condition : 9 - To ensure that no danger to the health and safety of local
    residents, or of those either implementing or occupying the
    proposed development, would result from the contamination
    of the site as a result of its previous use.

Condition : 10 - To ensure the permanent retention of the accommodation for
    parking purposes and to ensure that the use of the building
    does not add to traffic congestion.

Condition : 11 - 01Your attention is drawn to the need to consult the
    Council's Environmental Health & Consumer Services Section
    (Tel: 071 278 4444) in  relation to the provisions of the
    Health & Safety at Work Act 1974 andthe Control of
    Pollution Act 1974 which cover concerns in relation tothe
    possible contamination of the site and the presence of
    asbestosin the existing buildings to be demolished.

Condition : 12 - The enclosed leaflet sets out the Council's guidelines for
    the protection of trees on development sites.
